name: Byron Kirk
title: Data Professional
bio: Welcome to my professional portfolio! I created this page because LinkedIn keeps restricting my account for some reason and I have never experienced a company that is more difficult to get a hold of someone than them. It's as if gremlins came up with the most convulted system imaginable as a joke and managers took it serioulsy. So when an application asks for a link to get to know a little more about me, this website is to serve that purpose. If I hit a roadblock I like to try and figure things out on my own. It is a good way to learn and I love trying to learn new things and help others.

workExperience.position: Team Lead of Database Administration Infrastructure
responsibilities: Led 8-member DBA team in 24/7 operations; tuned alerts to cut false positives by 50%, improving incident response.
Directed zero-downtime migration of 300+ clustered production databases from Windows to Linux, reducing cutover time by 75% via automation.
Implemented MySQL InnoDB ClusterSet for one of the most critical mobile application databases, enabling seamless high-availability failover with no service disruption.
Coordinated patching/upgrades for 2,000+ MySQL instances and 100+ Couchbase clusters under enterprise change controls, maintaining stability and security.
Established access management standards to reduce permission drift and enhance audit compliance.
Oversaw development of internal Access Management portal, centralizing user access tracking across environments.
Served as Level III escalation point, resolving complex database issues tied to enterprise releases with minimal downtime.
Processed highest volume of JIRA access requests in 50-member DBA team, supporting 1,000+ developers with rapid turnaround.
Led deployment of 100+ critical databases in new Phoenix data center, validating infrastructure for future production expansion.
Developed and deployed Bash, PowerShell, and Python automation scripts, reducing manual workload and errors.
Completed four production-to-test refresh rotations independently, maintaining data integrity and uptime.
Migrated test databases from Windows to Linux, earning production responsibilities 6 months ahead of schedule.
Executed UTF8 collation migration in production with zero downtime, enabling expanded language support.
Provisioned 100+ PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Couchbase instances for high-availability enterprise applications.
